alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:58AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cimarron and northwestern Dallam Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 258 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Felt to 8 miles northeast of Texline. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Felt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma...and the Panhandle of Texas.
